titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 78: Miscellany of works on Catholic doctrine, canon law and religious life

notesStmt.note: Title supplied by cataloger. Zacour-Hirsch and Andrew Little give the title: Registrum primi [-quarti] libri sententiarum.
Spine label gives Nikolaus Jauer as the main heading for the entire manuscript.
There is evidence of slight water damage.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Contains six works generally concerned with Catholic doctrine, canon law and religious life, including a register of Peter Lombard's four books of Sentences, together with an index to St. Augustine's City of God and other notes. Also includes works by Nikolaus Jauer, Bartholomaeus de Ebraco and Caspar de Caldrinis, as well as two unattributed works.

msItem.title: Miscellany of works on Catholic doctrine, canon law and religious life
Register of the four books of Peter Lombard?s Sentences, f. 1r
Index to St. Augustine?s City of God and other notes, f. 23r

supportDesc.extent: 179 leaves : 294 x 220 (170 x 93) mm. bound to 297 x 228 mm

collation.p: Paper, 179; 1-2⁶, 3⁵, 4-14⁶, 15⁶(+1); [1-179]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto. Some catchwords visible, lower right verso of last leaf of each quire.

p.signatures: Arabic numerals, lower left corner, first recto of each quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a Gothic cursive book script by many hands, with marginal comments in several contemporary hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubricated capitals, initials, paragraph marks, and underlining throughout.

binding.p: 15th-century German blind stamped brown calf over pasteboards, badly abraded, with cut marks on upper and lower covers.

origin.p: Written in Germany in the first half of the 15th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Contains an old, unidentified shelf mark, E18 (f. 1r); purchased by Henry Charles Lea, 1877.
Passed to the University of Pennsylvania with the Lea Library.
